result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela Diane Lund

records.addlTxt:
It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joseph L. other than in the course of Defendant's employment. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:57 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo with Intern Connor Smith in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Angela Diane Lund in court. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD-PFAC given. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets STC to check on status of atty. Court may allow Zoom appearances if requested. NG.  Reserve on pre-plea rights. 
 Adjourned at 2:00 PM.  gll
